abstract: Pentagon releases 198 photos from investigations into detainee abuse in Afghanistan and Iraq taken almost decade ago; release is due to Freedom of Information Act suit filed by American Civil Liberties Union in wake of Abu Ghraib prison torture scandal in 2004.
lead_paragraph: The Pentagon on Friday released 198 photographs from detainee abuse investigations in the Afghanistan and Iraq wars, while blocking the release of 1,800 more.

headline.main: Pentagon Releases Small Portion of Photos From Detainee Abuse Cases
headline.print_headline: U.S. Limits Release of Detainee Abuse Case Photos

snippet: The Pentagon on Friday released 198 photographs from detainee abuse investigations in the Afghanistan and Iraq wars, while blocking the release of 1,800 more.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
